intro: Pilosella leptocaulon, commonly known as the slender-stemmed hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal and hairy, while the stems are slender and often slightly hairy as well. The flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
